page.title: 03TOURISM 1
page.content: "Without tourism Pitlochry would not exist" The above comment was made by the local tourist officer as he explained the attractions of Pitlochry : a nice Highland town . Visitors come from all over the world ,though a large percentage are Americans .From a street survey ,it would appear that in the early part of the season most are just passing through on bus journeys, or here for short stays. Most of the town is given over to providing accommodation for the invasion of tourists - either private houses providing"B+B"or the many hotels and guest houses providing between 2000 to 2500 bed spaces .The Atholl Palace is the visitor's first sight of Pitlochry, though cost means a drive to the humble caravan site.
